# Attempt to save a derived tag without entering a description.
# Observe that the derived tag saves without any error message.
# Enter a description exceeding 500 characters.
# Attempt to save the derived tag.
# Observe that the derived tag saves without any error message regarding the character limit.



* *Expected Behavior:*
** The entry should be limited to a maximum of 500 characters.
** Must stop accepting entries from the user once 500 character limit has been reached.



* *Actual Behavior:*
** The "Description" field allows entries exceeding 500 characters.

column1: CAT - Uploading Constants not in Master Constants List shows incorrect success message
column33:
Currently, users can upload constants to the "By Vessel" page, but if the uploaded constants are not present in the Master Constants List, they are not added, yet a success message is incorrectly shown. This behavior is incorrect and should be blocked. If a user attempts to upload a constant that is not in the Master Constants List, the upload action should be prevented and an error message should be displayed.



*Steps to Reproduce:*

# Navigate to the "By Vessel" page.
# Attempt to upload a constant that is not listed in the Master Constants List.
# Observe that a success message is shown, even though the constant is not added.



*Actual Result:*

* Constants not present in the Master Constants List are not added, but a success message is shown instead of an error message.

!by vessel adding error.mp4|width=1906,height=1064,alt="by vessel adding error.mp4"!



*Expected Result:*

* The system should validate the uploaded constants against the Master Constants List.
* If any constant is not found in the Master Constants List, the upload action should be blocked.
* An error message should be displayed: "Upload failed: Constants must be defined in the Master Constants List before they can be uploaded to a vessel."

*Error Handling Message:*

* Display the error message: "Upload failed: Constants must be defined in the Master Constants List before they can be uploaded to a vessel."

column1: CAT - Different vessel identification method for adding Constants in Vessel Constant List page.
column33:
There is an inconsistency in the method used to identify vessels when adding constants from the Vessel Constant List page. When adding a constant manually, the system uses the vessel name as the identifier. However, when using the bulk upload feature, the system uses the vessel IMO number to identify the vessel. This inconsistency can lead to confusion and potential data mismatches.



*Steps to Reproduce:*

# Navigate to the Vessel Constant List page.
# Add a constant manually and observe that the vessel is identified by its name.
# Use the bulk upload feature to add constants and observe that the vessel is identified by its IMO number.



*Actual Result:*

* The vessel name is used as an identifier when adding constants manually.
* The vessel IMO number is used as an identifier when adding constants via the bulk upload feature.



!while adding constant vessel name and while uploading vessel imo is used.mp4|width=1920,height=1080,alt="while adding constant vessel name and while uploading vessel imo is used.mp4"!



*Expected Result:*

* The system should use a consistent method to identify vessels when adding constants, whether manually or through the bulk upload feature. Preferably, a unique identifier such as the vessel IMO number should be used in both cases to avoid any ambiguity.

*Steps to Reproduce:*

column33:
+*Steps To Reproduce:*+

# Login to SMARTShip as DGUI user.
# Navigate to CAT module by selecting CA Library menu from top settings.
# By default user will land on the DERIVED/AGGREGATE TAGS tab.
# From there Import a Derived/Aggregate file.

+*Actual:*+

The system allows importing files with empty fields in the Derived Tag import functionality. The mandatory fields set in the "CREATE DERIVED TAG" page should also be designated as mandatory fields in importing file.

User is able to import file with empty *CATEGORY* field.

User is able to import file with empty *SYSTEM* field.

User is able to import file with empty *INSTANCE* field.

User is able to import file with empty *DERIVED TAG DISPLAY NAME* field.

User is able to import file with empty *DERIVED TAG NAME* field.

User is able to import file with empty *LEVEL* field.

User is able to import file with empty *UNIT* field.

User is able to import file with empty *ALIAS TAG NAME* field.

User is able to import file with empty *DATA TYPE* field.

User is able to import file with empty mandatory *TAG RANGE AND THRESHOLD INFORMATION* fields.

!alias and display name null bug.mp4|width=1920,height=1080,alt="alias and display name null bug.mp4"!

+*Expected:*+

The system should displaying an error message notifying the user that the mandatory fields are empty in the importing file, thus the import process can’t be executed. 

* The system should validate the import file and detect the null or empty fields.
* An error message should be displayed: “The file is not valid, please review, correct, and try again.”
* The import should be aborted, and the user should be prompted to correct the file.

column33:
# In the top right corner, there will be “Create” button:
## On mouse hover of the button, the following text will be displayed: “Create a new derived tag”
## On button selection, open the derived tag editor/creation screen.
# The derived tag library create/edit screen will differ slightly depending on whether it is a “cloud” and “edge” library or “noon report” library.

This page will provide access to creating or modifying an existing derived tag. The following features and functionalities should be available (reference to example mockup below):

# Entry of derived tag information including the following:
## Display Name
### Text entry field
### Up to 100 alphanumeric (and spaces, dashes, underscores) characters supported
## Tag Name
### Text entry field
### Up to 100 alphanumeric (dashes, underscores) characters supported (no spaces allowed)
## Alias
### Text entry field
### Up to 100 alphanumeric (dashes, underscores, and special) characters supported (no spaces allowed)
## Units
### Dropdown list of available units (same as what currently exists in SMARTShip derived tag manager)
### This list may grow over time, and therefore there must be an easy method to add more units (it can be a backend process for now, but must not require a release to update).
### The info icon on mouse hover should display: “Must apply “NONE” if no units apply.”
#### This is because the majority of derived tags will have units and ensuring entry will avoid mistakes.
## Category _(_*_Important_* _- cloud and edge only)_
### Dropdown list containing: “ENGINE ROOM MACHINERY”, “HULL AND CARGO”, and “NAVIGATIONAL EQUIPMENT”
### _Note. For “Noon Report” derived tags, the data should be displayed in the “External Data” application and therefore this entry field is not required._
## System _(_*_Important_* _- cloud and edge only)_
### This field should be in a disabled state until “Category” is selected
### Dropdown list containing list of applicable systems (full list to be provided by configuration team)
#### The Systems will differ depending on the “Category”
### _Note. For “Noon Report” derived tags, the data should be displayed in the “External Data” application and therefore this entry field is not required._
## Instance _(_*_Important_* _- cloud and edge only)_
### Dropdown list containing values between 1 to 30
### _Note. For “Noon Report” derived tags, the data should be displayed in the “External Data” application and therefore this entry field is not required._
## Data Type
### Dropdown list containing: “Boolean”, “Float”, “Integer”, and “String” 
## Description
### Optional field
### Text entry field
### Up to 300 characters supported

_Note1. All dropdown lists should be A→Z sorted_

_Note2. All fields are mandatory except “Description”_

2.  Entry of tag range and threshold information

# Associated Raw Alias for Limits
## Optional dropdown selection
## The info icon on mouse hover should display: “Thresholds and limits will be retrieved from the MDS for the respective vessel. Only common aliases that exist in the configured formulas are populated in the dropdown.”
## The dropdown options will be limited to only the aliases which are common in all the formulas.
## If a tag is selected, the other fields 2b to 2g will be in the disabled state, as the thresholds/limits will be taken from the respective raw tag for each vessel. E.g. If a cylinder exhaust gas temperature average derived tag is created, all formulas will contain at least cylinder 1 exhaust gas temperature and this raw tag will have threshold/limit information available in the MDS which may differ from vessel to vessel and should be used instead of hard coding for all vessels.
## Range Low
### Mandatory entry
### Numeric entry only
### Up to 3 decimals supported
### Must be less than “Alarm LL” or if “Alarm LL” not entered, “Alarm L” and so on to “Range High”.
## Alarm LL
### Optional entry
### Numeric entry only
### Up to 3 decimals supported
### Must be greater than “Range Low”
### Must be less than “Alarm L”  or if “Alarm L” not entered, “Alarm H” and so on to “Range High”.
## Alarm L
### Numeric entry only
### Up to 3 decimals supported
### Must be greater than “Alarm LL” or if “Alarm LL” not entered, “Range Low”.
### Must be less than “Alarm H” or if “Alarm H” not entered, “Alarm HH” and so on to “Range High”.
## Alarm H
### Numeric entry only
### Up to 3 decimals supported
### Must be greater than “Alarm L” or if “Alarm L” not entered, “Alarm LL” and so on to “Range Low”.
### Must be less than “Alarm HH” or if “Alarm HH” not entered, “Range High”.
## Alarm HH
### Numeric entry only
### Up to 3 decimals supported
### Must be greater than “Alarm H” or if “Alarm H” not entered, “Alarm L” and so on to “Range Low”.
### Must be less than “Range High”
## Range High
### Mandatory entry
### Numeric entry only
### Up to 3 decimals supported
### Must be greater than “Alarm HH” or if “Alarm HH” not entered, “Alarm H” and so on to “Range Low”.
## This “Tag range and threshold information” entire section should be in the disabled state until “Data Type” is selected.
### If data type “String” is selected, the section should remain in the disabled state/cleared, as no entry is required for string output.
### If data type “Boolean” is selected, the section should remain in the disabled state, with “Range Low” = 0 and “Range High” = 1, as boolean should only output two states (0 or 1).
# Audit log support
# The user, email address, and date/time of the creation of a derived tag should be logged.
## If imported, the user who initiated the import is to be logged.
## If manually created, at the time of saving to the table, the details should be logged.
## Any updates made for the derived tag should be logged.
## The last updated date/time, user, and associated email address should be displayed.
## The created date/time, user, and associated email address should be displayed.
## Comments
### Allow for free text entry
#### This is to allow entry of any notes that the user may want to store along with the configuration.
### Up to 300 characters to be supported
### Users can delete/edit the comment and the old comment does not need to be stored (can overwrite existing) without keeping track of the old comment.
# Formula logic information

Associated Raw Alias

# Manual text entry (may be a dropdown/searchable list containing all standardized raw aliases in the future)
## The info icon on mouse hover should display: “Enter the raw alias associated with the derived alias. If one may exist, it will be used rather than creating a duplicate derived tag. If none apply, enter “NONE”.”
## Prioritized?
### Checkbox (unchecked by default)
### This field will be in a disabled/unchecked state until text other than “NONE” is entered into the “Associated Raw Alias” field.
### The info icon on mouse hover should display: “If checked, if the associated raw alias exists for the respective vessel, the derived tag will not be created.”
# _Note. If this field is checked, while creating the derived tags for the respective vessel, this derived tag will be skipped as the raw tags already contain this parameter, and therefore the derived tag is unnecessary._

# Formulas

At least one formula entry is mandatory (maximum 30)

# The formula(s) should be a selectable box (with “Formula01” selected by default.
## Underneath the formula number, the number of tags used within the formula will be displayed.
## To the right of the formula, the description of the formula will be displayed.
## When selected, a white border will appear around the field.
### There will be an arrow displayed at the bottom and/or top of the selected formula, if multiple formulas are present to move the formula up or down in the list.
## When selected the following formula options will appear:
### Edit (pencil icon): When selected, the Derived Tag Formula Editor Screen will open with the existing formula configuration displayed.
### Copy (copy icon): when selected, the Derived Tag Formula Editor Screen will open with the formula number +1 from the formula copied (if any other formulas exist with a greater number should also be offset 1 once saved). Selecting this will copy the configuration and open the derived tag editor/creation screen where the user must modify the description.
### Delete (trash icon): when selecting this, open a popup window with the following text: “Are you sure you want to delete the Derived Tag <Formula##>?” with options “No, cancel” and “Yes, delete”
#### If “No, cancel” is selected, the popup window will close and the formula will remain in the table.
#### If “Yes, delete” is selected the popup window will close and the formula will be removed from the table (and if any other formulas exist with a greater number should also be offset -1). A temporary banner will be displayed (similar to in SMARTShip will display in the top right corner of the page)

## To the right of the selected formula, a “+” icon will be present and when selected, the Derived Tag Formula Editor Screen will open.
### On mouse hover of the “+” icon, the following text will be displayed: “Add new formula”
# Button for download 
# Download Icon:
## On mouse hover of the icon, the following text will be displayed: “Download configuration”
# Buttons for cancel and save
# Selecting the “Cancel” button will navigate the user back to the Derived Tag Library Home Screen
## Selecting the “Save” button will:
### Initiate validation that all mandatory fields are populated, ensure the “Display Name” and “Alias” do not already exist in the library, and ensure all formulas are acceptable.
#### If validation is successful, the derived tag will be saved to the library table and navigate the user back to the Derived Tag Library Home Screen. A temporary banner will be displayed (similar to in SMARTShip will display in the top right corner of the page)
#### If validation is not successful, a popup window will appear and display the following message in red text: “The derived tag configuration cannot be saved; please review, correct and try again.” with only an “OK” button option that when selected closes the popup. A temporary banner will be displayed (similar to in SMARTShip “Failed” will display in the top right corner of the page).
##### Ideally the specific reason(s) should be displayed in the popup message (such as duplicate “Display Name” or “Alias”).
# API Integration to create/edit the derived tag

Edge example mockup:

The Derived Tag List page lists the libraries imported and created /edited by user.

Created master Derived Tags will be listed in the CA Library landing page. On hover of  a row in the list the below icons will be visibe:

* Create
* Edit
* Copy
* Delete

# Edit (pencil icon): selecting this will open the derived tag editor/creation screen.
# Copy (copy icon): selecting this will copy the configuration and open the derived tag editor/creation screen where the user must modify the display name and alias.
## There cannot be duplicates of “Display Name” and “Alias”
# Delete (trash icon): selecting this will open a popup window with the following text: “Are you sure you want to delete the Derived Tag <Display Name> from the library?” with options “Cancel” and “Yes”

        If “Cancel” is selected, the popup window will close and the derived tag will remain in the table.

         If “Yes” is selected the popup window will close and the derived tag will be removed from the table. A temporary banner will be displayed (similar to in SMARTShip will display in the top right corner of the page)

# Reference the user selected library and raw, derived, and aggregated aliases configured in the MDS and derived/aggregated configuration (as well as AO Registry parameters).

### If all aliases specified in the formula exist, select the formula and create the notification
#### All associated alias that exist for the vessel should also be configured
#### The primary parameter should be stored along with associated threshold value from the formula
### ElseIf check the next formula…until n
### Else go to next notification

# Entry of notification information including the following:
## Display Name
### Text entry field
### Up to 100 alphanumeric (and spaces, dashes, underscores) characters supported
## Alias (to be confirmed with configuration team, as aliases aren’t really required for notifications, but there must be a standardized backend name, so I’m suggesting to use aliases)
### Text entry field
### Up to 100 alphanumeric (dashes, underscores, and special) characters supported (no spaces allowed)
## Category
### Dropdown list containing: “ENGINE ROOM MACHINERY”, “HULL AND CARGO”, and “NAVIGATIONAL EQUIPMENT”
## App
### Dropdown list containing list of applications (full list to be provided by configuration team)
## Source Type - Note. this is not displayed in the mockup, but should be hard coded on the backend as “sensor” for edge and cloud libraries and “noon report” for noon report libraries.
## Frequency _(_*_Important_* _- cloud only)_
### Dropdown list containing: “Daily” and “Real-Time”
## Duration _(_*_Important_* _- cloud only)_
### The field should be in a disabled state until ‘Frequency’ is selected
### On mouse hover of the info icon, the following text should display: “Set a daily cumulative time threshold; if the criteria are met for this total duration within a day, the notification will be triggered.”
### If the ‘Frequency’ is “Real-Time” the field should remain in a disabled state and the ‘Duration’ should be uneditable and set to “30 sec”
#### _Note. The update rate for any vessel will either be 30 sec or 1 min and the real-time notifications should be triggered/cleared based on only one timestamp where all data is available for the given notification logic._
### If the ‘Frequency’ is “Daily” the field should change to the enabled state and allow the user to set the ‘Duration’ with the following constraints:
#### Entry of a numeric value in the first field (validation 1-1440)
#### Dropdown selection in the second field with options “m” for minutes and “h” for hours
##### There should be validation performed highlighting red if the combination of input parameters is not within 1-24 hours or 1 -1440 minutes.
## Time Delay _(_*_Important_* _- edge only)_
### On mouse hover of the info icon, the following text should display: “Specify a duration in which the set criteria must be continuously met for the notification to be triggered.”
### Entry of a numeric value in the first field (validation 1-1440)
### Dropdown selection in the second field with options “s” for seconds,  “m” for minutes, and “h” for hours
#### There should be validation performed highlighting red if the combination of input parameters is not within 0-60 seconds, 1 -1440 minutes, or 1-24 hours.
## Time Delay (Reset) _(_*_Important_* _- edge only)_
### On mouse hover of the info icon, the following text should display: “Specify a duration in which the set criteria must be continuously NOT met for the notification to be cleared.”
### Entry of a numeric value in the first field (validation 1-1440)
### Dropdown selection in the second field with options “s” for seconds,  “m” for minutes, and “h” for hours
#### There should be validation performed highlighting red if the combination of input parameters is not within 0-60 seconds, 1 -1440 minutes, or 1-24 hours.
## Severity
### 4 icons for severity to be displayed with “info” being the default setting
## Description
### Text entry field
### Up to 300 characters supported
## Probable Cause/ Suggested Measures
### Text entry field
### Up to 500 characters supported
## Open engineering question - I believe there are specific UUIDs set for each notification; how should/will this be handled? Ideally the user would not have to see/set.

_Note1. All dropdown lists should be A→Z sorted_

_Note2. All fields are mandatory; even the description and probable causes/suggested measures as these should be entered to ensure proper information displayed/maintain professionalism._

column33:
*_Important Note._* _The derived tag library create/edit screen will differ slightly depending on whether it is a “cloud” and “edge” library or “noon report” library. The details are specified below and two mockups are provided above._



The derived tag library create/edit screen will provide access to creating or modifying an existing derived tag. The following features and functionalities should be available (reference to example mockup above):

# Entry of derived tag information including the following:
## Display Name
### Text entry field
### Up to 100 alphanumeric (and spaces, dashes, underscores) characters supported
## Tag Name
### Text entry field
### Up to 100 alphanumeric (dashes, underscores) characters supported (no spaces allowed)
## Alias
### Text entry field
### Up to 100 alphanumeric (dashes, underscores, and special) characters supported (no spaces allowed)
## Units
### Dropdown list of available units (same as what currently exists in SMARTShip derived tag manager)
### This list may grow over time, and therefore there must be an easy method to add more units (it can be a backend process for now, but must not require a release to update).
### The info icon on mouse hover should display: “Must apply “NONE” if no units apply.”
#### This is because the majority of derived tags will have units and ensuring entry will avoid mistakes.
## Category _(_*_Important_* _- cloud and edge only)_
### Dropdown list containing: “ENGINE ROOM MACHINERY”, “HULL AND CARGO”, and “NAVIGATIONAL EQUIPMENT”
### _Note. For “Noon Report” derived tags, the data should be displayed in the “External Data” application and therefore this entry field is not required._
## System _(_*_Important_* _- cloud and edge only)_
### This field should be in a disabled state until “Category” is selected
### Dropdown list containing list of applicable systems (full list to be provided by configuration team)
#### The Systems will differ depending on the “Category”
### _Note. For “Noon Report” derived tags, the data should be displayed in the “External Data” application and therefore this entry field is not required._
## Instance _(_*_Important_* _- cloud and edge only)_
### Dropdown list containing values between 1 to 30
### _Note. For “Noon Report” derived tags, the data should be displayed in the “External Data” application and therefore this entry field is not required._
## Data Type
### Dropdown list containing: “Boolean”, “Float”, “Integer”, and “String” 
## Description
### Optional field
### Text entry field
### Up to 300 characters supported

_Note1. All dropdown lists should be A→Z sorted_

_Note2. All fields are mandatory except “Description”_

# Entry of tag range and threshold information
## Associated Raw Alias for Limits
### Optional dropdown selection
### The info icon on mouse hover should display: “Thresholds and limits will be retrieved from the MDS for the respective vessel. Only +common aliases+ that exist in the configured formulas are populated in the dropdown.”
### The dropdown options will be limited to only the aliases which are common in all the formulas.
### If a tag is selected, the other fields 2b to 2g will be in the disabled state, as the thresholds/limits will be taken from the respective raw tag for each vessel. E.g. If a cylinder exhaust gas temperature average derived tag is created, all formulas will contain at least cylinder 1 exhaust gas temperature and this raw tag will have threshold/limit information available in the MDS which may differ from vessel to vessel and should be used instead of hard coding for all vessels.
## Range Low
### Mandatory entry
### Numeric entry only
### Up to 3 decimals supported
### Must be less than “Alarm LL” or if “Alarm LL” not entered, “Alarm L” and so on to “Range High”.
## Alarm LL
### Optional entry
### Numeric entry only
### Up to 3 decimals supported
### Must be greater than “Range Low”
### Must be less than “Alarm L”  or if “Alarm L” not entered, “Alarm H” and so on to “Range High”.
## Alarm L
### Numeric entry only
### Up to 3 decimals supported
### Must be greater than “Alarm LL” or if “Alarm LL” not entered, “Range Low”.
### Must be less than “Alarm H” or if “Alarm H” not entered, “Alarm HH” and so on to “Range High”.
## Alarm H
### Numeric entry only
### Up to 3 decimals supported
### Must be greater than “Alarm L” or if “Alarm L” not entered, “Alarm LL” and so on to “Range Low”.
### Must be less than “Alarm HH” or if “Alarm HH” not entered, “Range High”.
## Alarm HH
### Numeric entry only
### Up to 3 decimals supported
### Must be greater than “Alarm H” or if “Alarm H” not entered, “Alarm L” and so on to “Range Low”.
### Must be less than “Range High”
## Range High
### Mandatory entry
### Numeric entry only
### Up to 3 decimals supported
### Must be greater than “Alarm HH” or if “Alarm HH” not entered, “Alarm H” and so on to “Range Low”.
## This “Tag range and threshold information” entire section should be in the disabled state until “Data Type” is selected.
### If data type “String” is selected, the section should remain in the disabled state/cleared, as no entry is required for string output.
### If data type “Boolean” is selected, the section should remain in the disabled state, with “Range Low” = 0 and “Range High” = 1, as boolean should only output two states (0 or 1).
# Audit log support
## The user, email address, and date/time of the creation of a derived tag should be logged.
### If imported, the user who initiated the import is to be logged.
### If manually created, at the time of saving to the table, the details should be logged.
### Any updates made for the derived tag should be logged.
## The last updated date/time, user, and associated email address should be displayed.
## The created date/time, user, and associated email address should be displayed.
# Comments
## Allow for free text entry
### This is to allow entry of any notes that the user may want to store along with the configuration.
## Up to 300 characters to be supported
## Users can delete/edit the comment and the old comment does not need to be stored (can overwrite existing) without keeping track of the old comment.
# Formulas
## At least one formula entry is mandatory (maximum 30)

column1: [1.8.1 CAT] - DTL Create/Edit page
column33:
# The derived tag library create/edit screen will differ slightly depending on whether it is a “cloud” and “edge” library or “noon report” library.
This page will provide access to creating or modifying an existing derived tag. The following features and functionalities should be available (reference to example mockup below):
## Entry of derived tag information including the following:
### Display Name
#### Text entry field
#### Up to 100 alphanumeric (and spaces, dashes, underscores) characters supported
### Tag Name
#### Text entry field
#### Up to 100 alphanumeric (dashes, underscores) characters supported (no spaces allowed)
### Alias
#### Text entry field
#### Up to 100 alphanumeric (dashes, underscores, and special) characters supported (no spaces allowed)
### Units
#### Dropdown list of available units (same as what currently exists in SMARTShip derived tag manager)
#### This list may grow over time, and therefore there must be an easy method to add more units (it can be a backend process for now, but must not require a release to update).
#### The info icon on mouse hover should display: “Must apply “NONE” if no units apply.”
##### This is because the majority of derived tags will have units and ensuring entry will avoid mistakes.
### Category _(_*_Important_* _- cloud and edge only)_
#### Dropdown list containing: “ENGINE ROOM MACHINERY”, “HULL AND CARGO”, and “NAVIGATIONAL EQUIPMENT”
#### _Note. For “Noon Report” derived tags, the data should be displayed in the “External Data” application and therefore this entry field is not required._
### System _(_*_Important_* _- cloud and edge only)_
#### This field should be in a disabled state until “Category” is selected
#### Dropdown list containing list of applicable systems (full list to be provided by configuration team)
##### The Systems will differ depending on the “Category”
#### _Note. For “Noon Report” derived tags, the data should be displayed in the “External Data” application and therefore this entry field is not required._
### Instance _(_*_Important_* _- cloud and edge only)_
#### Dropdown list containing values between 1 to 30
#### _Note. For “Noon Report” derived tags, the data should be displayed in the “External Data” application and therefore this entry field is not required._
### Data Type
#### Dropdown list containing: “Boolean”, “Float”, “Integer”, and “String” 
### Description
#### Optional field
#### Text entry field
#### Up to 300 characters supported
# _Note1. All dropdown lists should be A→Z sorted_
_Note2. All fields are mandatory except “Description”_
2.  Entry of tag range and threshold information
## Associated Raw Alias for Limits
### Optional dropdown selection
### The info icon on mouse hover should display: “Thresholds and limits will be retrieved from the MDS for the respective vessel. Only common aliases that exist in the configured formulas are populated in the dropdown.”
### The dropdown options will be limited to only the aliases which are common in all the formulas.
### If a tag is selected, the other fields 2b to 2g will be in the disabled state, as the thresholds/limits will be taken from the respective raw tag for each vessel. E.g. If a cylinder exhaust gas temperature average derived tag is created, all formulas will contain at least cylinder 1 exhaust gas temperature and this raw tag will have threshold/limit information available in the MDS which may differ from vessel to vessel and should be used instead of hard coding for all vessels.
### Range Low
#### Mandatory entry
#### Numeric entry only
#### Up to 3 decimals supported
#### Must be less than “Alarm LL” or if “Alarm LL” not entered, “Alarm L” and so on to “Range High”.
### Alarm LL
#### Optional entry
#### Numeric entry only
#### Up to 3 decimals supported
#### Must be greater than “Range Low”
#### Must be less than “Alarm L”  or if “Alarm L” not entered, “Alarm H” and so on to “Range High”.
### Alarm L
#### Numeric entry only
#### Up to 3 decimals supported
#### Must be greater than “Alarm LL” or if “Alarm LL” not entered, “Range Low”.
#### Must be less than “Alarm H” or if “Alarm H” not entered, “Alarm HH” and so on to “Range High”.
### Alarm H
#### Numeric entry only
#### Up to 3 decimals supported
#### Must be greater than “Alarm L” or if “Alarm L” not entered, “Alarm LL” and so on to “Range Low”.
#### Must be less than “Alarm HH” or if “Alarm HH” not entered, “Range High”.
### Alarm HH
#### Numeric entry only
#### Up to 3 decimals supported
#### Must be greater than “Alarm H” or if “Alarm H” not entered, “Alarm L” and so on to “Range Low”.
#### Must be less than “Range High”
### Range High
#### Mandatory entry
#### Numeric entry only
#### Up to 3 decimals supported
#### Must be greater than “Alarm HH” or if “Alarm HH” not entered, “Alarm H” and so on to “Range Low”.
### This “Tag range and threshold information” entire section should be in the disabled state until “Data Type” is selected.
#### If data type “String” is selected, the section should remain in the disabled state/cleared, as no entry is required for string output.
#### If data type “Boolean” is selected, the section should remain in the disabled state, with “Range Low” = 0 and “Range High” = 1, as boolean should only output two states (0 or 1).

3. Audit log support

# The user, email address, and date/time of the creation of a derived tag should be logged.
## If imported, the user who initiated the import is to be logged.
## If manually created, at the time of saving to the table, the details should be logged.
## Any updates made for the derived tag should be logged.
## The last updated date/time, user, and associated email address should be displayed.
## The created date/time, user, and associated email address should be displayed.
## Comments
### Allow for free text entry
#### This is to allow entry of any notes that the user may want to store along with the configuration.
### Up to 300 characters to be supported
### Users can delete/edit the comment and the old comment does not need to be stored (can overwrite existing) without keeping track of the old comment.

4. Formula logic information

# Associated Raw Alias
## Manual text entry (may be a dropdown/searchable list containing all standardized raw aliases in the future)
## The info icon on mouse hover should display: “Enter the raw alias associated with the derived alias. If one may exist, it will be used rather than creating a duplicate derived tag. If none apply, enter “NONE”.”
## Prioritized?
### Checkbox (unchecked by default)
### This field will be in a disabled/unchecked state until text other than “NONE” is entered into the “Associated Raw Alias” field.
### The info icon on mouse hover should display: “If checked, if the associated raw alias exists for the respective vessel, the derived tag will not be created.”
# _Note. If this field is checked, while creating the derived tags for the respective vessel, this derived tag will be skipped as the raw tags already contain this parameter, and therefore the derived tag is unnecessary._ 

5. Formulas

# At least one formula entry is mandatory (maximum 30)
## The formula(s) should be a selectable box (with “Formula01” selected by default.
### Underneath the formula number, the number of tags used within the formula will be displayed.
### To the right of the formula, the description of the formula will be displayed.
### When selected, a white border will appear around the field.
#### There will be an arrow displayed at the bottom and/or top of the selected formula, if multiple formulas are present to move the formula up or down in the list.
### When selected the following formula options will appear:
#### Edit (pencil icon): When selected, the Derived Tag Formula Editor Screen will open with the existing formula configuration displayed.
#### Copy (copy icon): when selected, the Derived Tag Formula Editor Screen will open with the formula number +1 from the formula copied (if any other formulas exist with a greater number should also be offset 1 once saved). Selecting this will copy the configuration and open the derived tag editor/creation screen where the user must modify the description.
#### Delete (trash icon): when selecting this, open a popup window with the following text: “Are you sure you want to delete the Derived Tag <Formula##>?” with options “No, cancel” and “Yes, delete”
##### If “No, cancel” is selected, the popup window will close and the formula will remain in the table.
##### If “Yes, delete” is selected the popup window will close and the formula will be removed from the table (and if any other formulas exist with a greater number should also be offset -1). A temporary banner will be displayed (similar to in SMARTShip will display in the top right corner of the page)

### To the right of the selected formula, a “+” icon will be present and when selected, the Derived Tag Formula Editor Screen will open.

6. Button for download

7. Buttons for cancel and save

# Selecting the “Cancel” button will navigate the user back to the Derived Tag Library Home Screen

##### Ideally the specific reason(s) should be displayed in the popup message (such as duplicate “Display Name” or “Alias”).

8.  API Integration to create/edit the derived tag

column1: Recalculation of derived tag upon edit
column33:
For the POC purpose, derived tag configuration was given as excel configuration and the same was read to calculate derived tags. In case a new derived tag is added or existing one is edited, the whole derived tag configuration will be considered again during data replay. This will take so much time as whole derived tags will be recalculated again. To overcome this limitation, there should be provision to recalculate only the newly added or updated derived tags. 

As part of making the application production ready, derived tags configuration are now saved in dynamo db. The details of the same are available in the user story [https://alphaori.atlassian.net/browse/SMAR-58143|https://alphaori.atlassian.net/browse/SMAR-58143|smart-link]. 

The given below changes should be considered as part of this user story

# The new derived tags as well as the updated derived tags details should be added to the dynamo db table - vessel-config
# The updated derived tag details should be added to the dynamo db table - (new table)
# The flow of the new derived tags and updated derived tags will be different
